subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Sunday, 17 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Beckham primed for title decider
David Beckham hopes to end his Real Madrid career on a high by helping the club win the title before he leaves to join LA Galaxy.



 
Motherwell to announce new boss
Motherwell owner John Boyle says the club will reveal the identity of their new manager on Tuesday.



 
Blades set for tribunal decision
Sheffield United are hoping an independent arbitration panel will overturn their relegation from the Premier League this week.








GOLF




Live - US Open
Leader Aaron Baddeley will tee off with Tiger Woods at 2000 BST in the final round at Oakmont.



 
Woods calls on 'major experience'
Tiger Woods is confident he can see off golf's younger guard and win his 13th major at the US Open on Sunday.



 
Baddeley in front but Tiger looms
Aaron Baddeley will take a two-shot lead into the final round of the US Open but the chasing pack is led by Tiger Woods.








MOTORSPORT




Live - US Grand Prix
Briton Lewis Hamilton starts on pole at Indianapolis aiming for his second straight Formula One win.



 
Bayliss celebrates double success
Troy Bayliss wins both races in San Marino to cut James Toseland's lead in the World Superbikes standings.



 
Audi win to retain Le Mans crown
Audi's No 1 car comes home first in the Le Man 24-Hours race in France.








FORMULA ONE




Live - US Grand Prix
Briton Lewis Hamilton starts on pole at Indianapolis aiming for his second straight Formula One win.



 
Hamilton on pole at US Grand Prix
Britain's Lewis Hamilton pips McLaren team-mate Fernando Alonso to pole at the US GP at Indianapolis.



 
US GP's future set to be decided
F1 supremo Bernie Ecclestone will decide the future of the US Grand Prix by mid-July, say Indianapolis officials.








ATHLETICS




Devonish best dashed by mistake
Marlon Devonish could see his 100m personal best removed from the records because of an administrative mistake in Oslo.



 
Idowu shines in Golden League win
Phillips Idowu beats the world's best triple jumpers to claim the opening Golden League meeting in Oslo.



 
Yelling withdraws from GB squad
Liz Yelling pulls out of the GB marathon squad for this summer's World Athletics Championships in Osaka.








CYCLING




Moreau secures Dauphine victory
Frenchman Christophe Moreau wins the Dauphine Libere after a rain-hit final stage is won by Alexandre Vinokourov.



 
Unibet blasts cycling 'scandal'
An online gaming firm says a decision to ban the cycling team it sponsors from the Tour de France is a "scandal".



 
Moreau into lead as Iglinsky wins
Frenchman Christophe Moreau leads the Dauphine Libere after the sixth stage is won by Kazakhstan's Maxim Iglinsky.








FUN AND GAMES




Review of the week
Michael Vaughan hits the town as Messi keeps his hand in



 
Quotes of the Week
Ramon Calderon on David Beckham, plus Lewis Hamilton and Graham Taylor



 
Ten to Tackle
Test your knowledge of the last seven days in sport
